abstracts.cdata!:
The Decentralized Planning and Financing
            Project for Mozambique aims to improve the institutional
            capacity of District Administrations, and to plan and manage
            small infrastructure investments in response to community
            demand. Continued commitment by Government to fiscal and
            administrative decentralization, particularly from
            Ministries of State Administration and Planning and Finance;
            as well as continued Government commitment to community
            participation and empowerment. Sustained political and
            budgetary commitment to the provision of basic
            infrastructure and social services, and to the progress of
            the public sector reform program. The project has the
            following five components: Component 1) The Participatory
            District Planning will develop a District-level
            participatory planning system based on civil society
            consultation, and participation. It will deepen and expand
            the experience of a decentralized planning, and finance
            pilot in Nampula province. Component 2) provides Financing
            for small rural infrastructure in the annual plans that will
            be made available to eligible districts as local investment
            grants, up to a certain threshold and according to a set of
            qualification criteria. Component 3) capacity building will
            strengthen the training system to increase the capacity of
            local administration officials to undertake key local
            government functions more effectively. Component 4) Policy
            Reform will consist of technical assistance to the
            Government of Mozambique (GOM) to improve decision-making
            through policy analysis and for the further development of
            the institutional and policy framework for decentralization.
            Component 5) will consist of a small core team of project
            coordination staff at central and provincial level who will
            fulfill some World Bank-specific fiduciary functions and
            provide technical assistance to the government officials
            responsible for project implementation and GOM fiduciary functions.
